item.title: Simplicity vs Abstraction
item.description: Simplicity and abstraction isn’t the lack of complexity, it is a way to deal with complexity. Complexity is when something is made up of many entities and have innumerable interactions between each other, to such a degree that it is difficult to keep track of them consciously at once. Simplicity is complexity organized and extraneous things omitted, which makes the navigability of entities and interactions a lot easier. Abstraction is hiding complexity, and only showing what is relevant to a certain use case or situation at the cost of losing capability.
